title: As a Plat 1 Yasuo main with 400+ Yasuo games, Yasuo needs a damn rework.
body:
Plat 1’s not the highest of ELOs, but I have hundreds of games with Yasuo and he is the only champion I really enjoy in League and can play every match without getting bored of - but his current state is cancer and mere numbers changes won’t fix him. 

After his huge wave of nerfs, Yasuo’s basically lost his identity as a champion because his kit is just unimaginably difficult to balance. He has simultaneously the highest ban-rate AND the lowest win-rate in solo queue because ain't nobody want his ass on their own team, and certainly don't want him on the enemy team either. 

I’m supposing that Riot intended to release a very unique melee DPS champion who has a strong balance of offense, defense, and utility - and quite possibly become the first mADC that’s not uber-cancer. But instead his most popular play-style currently across almost every ELO is a LOT like a Japanese version of Fiora where he ults into a team fight, spams everything, and hopes to deal tons of damage before he dies in 2 hits. We already have plenty of cheese-lord melee “baneling” ADCs, we don’t need Yasuo to be another mADC glass cannon with just a slightly different power-spike path.{{champion:11}} {{champion:23}} {{champion:114}} 


*Here’s my suggestions to change Yasuo:*

* -Remove his double crit. What the hell was the point of it? It makes his power spikes stupid strong and completely inconsistent with any other champion in the game and cancer to play against. It doesn’t really contribute to him thematically (Does have 20 eyes like {{champion:11}} {{champion:24}}  or something?), has no counterplay, limits his build paths, and just seems like a gimick damage steroid that was thrown on to boost his DPS up to match other mADCs, but in the end has cost his kit a LOT in nerfs just to keep.

* -Restore the strength of his shields and his W’s passive but reduce it’s duration. His flow/shields/windwall are what make him unique to other mADCs. 
Unsurprisingly, the “Japanese wind guy with a sword” is a pretty established trope, and for damn good reason: it’s cool as hell and almost makes sense. What DOESN’T make sense is why Riot decided to keep his uber-gimmick crit passive, but nerfed the flow/turbulence system that was central to Yasuo into a gimmick.
To add more interactivity with his shield, it should only activate when he faces away from the damage source, and of course when he ults. It’s actually pretty arbitrary what his shield trigger should be, but it sure as hell shouldn’t be “whenever the hell it’s up”. Having it only activate when he turns away kind of fits into his “always on the run” lore, synergies with his dash, has a ton of interactivity, and allows opponents to trade with him when he goes on the offense.

* -His Windwall should drain his  FLOW. Allow it to completely eat the first non-minion projectile, give it a small amount of base health, and allow it to have scaling health based off how much Flow Yasuo has. It doesn’t make sense that Yasuo has to generate his flow to cast his passive shield, but suddenly whips a ton of wind out of his ass-cheeks to cast an indestructible wall of flatulence. Combined with his original Windwall passive, leveling this ability gives him a stronger wall because he generates flow quicker.

* -Remove the damage on his E. Clearly the early game damage on his E for a late-game scaling champion like Yasuo has been a problem for the balance team (Smells like Tristana). His sweeping blade is used for mobility and flow, not everything needs to do damage.

* -Make his ult do more damage and remove the armor pen on it. Like, what was the point of his current ult? Probably the most satisfying thing on Yasuo is flying into the air, screaming wildly, and slamming the enemy team into the ground to do an outrageous amount of damage, but that’s actually NOT what happens with his current ult. Almost all of his current ult’s power lies in the armor pen it gives (why does it even give armor pen?) and its utility. You can’t even Q during his ult anymore, so when he screams and body slams enemies, it actually does a very unsatisfying amount of damage.






**TL;DR: 
-Make him do less damage because we don't need more {{champion:114}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:114}} 
-Remove the non-interactive and uncounterable parts of his kit (his stupid crit and armor pen)
-Remove the gimmicks, reinforce his theme
-Make him tankier so noob-suos can stop feeding.**


Update:
The main concern seems to be that Yasuo would be lacking damage with these changes, but I don't think this would be the case.

It's not necessary for Yasuo to remain an Assassin/mADC, actually given his relationship with Riven, it'd make a lot of sense for him to be a fighter. His AA reset with Steel Tempest is already a huge boost to his DPS, something closer to Riven's Q rather than Yi/Trynd. Like Riven, he doesn't need to build a lot of AS, he will max out with only Shiv assuming you have proper runes and masteries, which means he has space for other itemization.

Besides, logically he shouldn't have anywhere near the same amount of damage as pure DPS champions because he has one of the most CC heavy kits in the game.

This... isn't much of a rework. If anything, you're taking away all his power and giving him...nothing solid in return.

On the contrary, I'm suggesting we remove some of his uninteractive strengths and shift his power to more visible and interactive outlets.

Adding damage to his ult activation and taking away his armor pen makes for a bigger splat against squishies but allow tanks to itemize against Yasuo, which is pretty fun for everyone. It also removes the huge pressure for late-game Yasuo to "ult whatever gets knocked up" just to get his armor pen as soon as possible - allowing for more strategic gameplay.

Restoring his old shields makes him tankier and more forgiving to play, so teams won't be scared and frantically LoLKing-ing an ally who picks Yasuo in order to decide whether or not to dodge.


Perhaps these suggestions may or may not leave him on the weak side, but giving him a healthier and more clearly defined kit is the first step to a better Yasuo

Yeah, if I'm correct what you're suggesting is take away damage from vague sources like E and the post R armour pen and localizing it to very identifiable things. The Crit is also vague and gives an incredibly unbalanced power spike (most lategame champs need more than two items to achieve their respective lategames). 

One of the issues with Yasuo I've always had is that he just does too many things and has too much to work with. While that's the key point of a higher skill champion, on Yas it's too much. Right now, he has the same amount of stuff in his kit as he did before the big nerfs, but now they're all weaker across the board. It's better to have identifiable and fewer strengths (three things that each have a 4/5 in power rather than then things ten things that each have a power of 1/5) than vague and multiple mediocrities. He's not combo-oriented, he's not supposed to chain everything like Veigar or Syndra.

However, thinking on it the thing that makes Yasuo a lategame mADC is his crit chance. He doesnt have the natural autoattack steroids of {{champion:11}} {{champion:114}} {{champion:24}} , so he can't just build the same as them (AD, AS, Crit) and still be (as) effective. Current Yasuo is pigeonholed into building crit, crit and more crit, with the mandatory Last Whisper after IE/SS. So if you want to remove crit chance (something I'm wholly in favour of because it broadens him as a character and a champion) you'd have to come up with some sort of compensation in damage. I personally don't think I have the experience in either the champion or the game - as much as you at least - to suggest something valid, but perhaps you might consider it?

You said you would buff the Shield passive, but then you want him to be unable to pop the shield whenever he is facing the enemy.

How does that even make sense? You have a stronger shield that only works when you are running away or when you ult? 

Then you want his Windwall to have a health bar and scale with Max HP. This already is a nerf by itself. The windwall in its current form is unbreakable and blocks nearly all projectiles.

You want his E to deal no damage, which honestly, I really don't care as I only use it for lvl 2 cheeses, farm creeps in the lane and to dodge spells in teamfights. Whatever. 

But then you take the free bonus pen he gets from his ult and want to give him bonus damage as compensation for it.

So you are taking away:

- Double crit chance, something that is a huge part of his kit, you want to take it away and give nothing in return.

- The actual usefullness of his shield, even if it is stronger, it only really pops on his ult and when he is facing away from the enemy, what's the point of him having a shield if the shield is not there when he needs the most?
Even if it regens faster.

- The Windwall usefullness. Giving it an HP bar, when it is unbreakable in its current form, allowing him to only use the Windwall when his Flow is full, which he might aswell do anyway as the shield you suggested would literally be useless.

- Taking away the damage from his E, whatever, makes last hitting slightly harder.

- The Bonus Armor pen he gets from his ult, sure, you want it to nuke harder in return. Sure, it would allow tankier champs to itemize easier against him, but would that extra damage compensate for all the Bonus Armor pen you would take away from him?

Assassins are defined by the need to engage opportunistically, high burst damage, ease in picking off exposed targets and defense primarily in the form of spliperiness and high mobility. That's Yasuo defined. Melee AD carries tend to have strong assassin elements because there isn't any other way for them to function. Long cooldowns and combos are champion-specific balance and design elements. If they're made defensive, then they build defenses and become bruisers. If they have offense and mobility, they use it to instagib people and get out. If they can't do either, they don't get played (see old AD lifesteal tank Sion). You can define melee AD carries as a subclass of assassin.

Before I get into this, I want to make my general point clear: The overall motivation for wanting to rework Yasuo isn't bad. Trying to make a non-assassin style melee carry is desirable. However, if you just make it tanky with no scaling damage build options, it turns into a autoattacking bruiser like Xin Zhao. There are possibilites for making a better melee carry, but this specific rework idea has absolutely no chance of accomplishing it. The actual details of this rework are bad. This rework has very little that will make Yasuo work in any way other than a bruiser.

>kha zix gets no sht without his ult, no evolutions so yeah his main kill potential is his ult

Kha has his evolutions tied to his abilities. He may get them at level 6 and 11 and 16, but they are in no way tied to his ult for actual fighting purposes. He can get in, murder something and get out without pressing R. He's not ult reliant.

Also, for his assassin elements, Yasuo is quite reliant on his ult. He uses it to get in and instaburst people. It does that job quite well. He meets your "ult-reliant" qualification very well.

>the main gooal riot had when creating yasuo was to give meele the tools he needs to work as meele adc instead of being tied to assasins playstyle

First, I don't think that was Riot's goal. Riot has spoken ain the past about how squishy melee champions are always going to tend towards assassin elements because otherwise there isn't any reason to pick them over safer and more consistent ranged carries. If a melee champion is low-burst and squishy but has decent sustained dps, then they have to build tanky instead.

This isn't even unique to League. In Dota, melee carries tend to build tanky, and they rely on base damages or rewards for fighting for extended periods of time. Damage doesn't rely nearly so much on scaling modifiers there, so it's much easier for them to work building tanky. That isn't an option in League.

Second, even if that is a viable goal, this rework has no chance to accomplish it. If you have no reward for building scaling damage, there isn't going to be any scaling damage, and if there is no burst, then tankiness is going to be needed. We've seen this exact form of melee carry before. It's called Xin Zhao. Decent tankiness and sustained damage but without any scaling damage item options = bruiser. That is a form of melee carry, but it's not the type Yasuo should be.

The only way this rework will work with Yasuo still being a melee ADC is if it has a higher straight nuke on the Q and the ult nuke is majorly increased so they can almost instagib squishies. So, if he can assassinate with those, he'll do ok. I don't think that's the goal here though.

Look, I get that you want a melee ADC that isn't assassin-style. That's not a bad idea. However, just making it bruiser style isn't the right way to go, and with no scaling damage options and no burst, that's all you're going to have. There needs to be a real scaling damage option. As much as OP hates them, there is going to have to be a steroid. If there isn't, I'm not going to use him as an autoattacking carry. It's as simple as that. There just won't be any reason to.

Yasuo gets a lot of damage from animation canceling, theoretically he doesn't need to build a lot of attack speed because unlike Trynd/Yi, he can use Steel Tempest to artificially boost his DPS. This in itself is a very strong damage steroid.

I don't necessarily think he needs to remain a melee ADC in the traditional sense (crits + super DPS), but he needs to have the less interactive parts of his kits swapped out because his current balancing sacrifices his champion theme just to keep frustrating elements of his kit around, which is annoying for both the player and the opponent.

I drew the Fiora comparison because she's a mADC that once she commits, she doesn't expect to retreat or reposition - not necessarily because her ult is an insta-gib. Yasuo's original kit was built to be a skirmisher, but at the moment is being played very similarly to Fiora because Riot kept his offensive passives, but gutted his Flow/Shields.

As for the proposed ult changes on Yasuo, my thought is that by removing the armor pen but boosting the upfront damage, Last Breathe will have a lot more interactivity for both the player and the opponent. Most obviously, doing more damage with such a flashy ability is both expected and celebrated, but perhaps less obvious is: as I mentioned in a post earlier in this thread, when Yasuo hits late game, he's extremely pressured to ult the first safe target he can in a team fight - even if it's a tank because his armor pen is too strong to wait to activate midway through an engagement. This is both frustrating for the player because he can't afford to hold his ult for an opportune moment given how important the armor pen is and how likely he is to die early in the fight - and it's similarly frustrating for the opponent because obviously building 300 armor just to get shredded like a squishy is pretty lame. It's also quite annoying how players are punished even if they avoid Yasuo's ult because if an ally sets off Yasuo's armor pen, anyone Yasuo targets also suffers his armor pen.
